intro: Jeffersonia lobata, commonly known as the Jeffersonia or the mountain hellebore, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountain meadows. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to thrive in well-drained soils. Jeffersonia lobata is notable for its medicinal and ornamental value, though it contains toxic compounds that require careful handling.
